intro: Satureja forbesii, commonly known as Forbes' savory, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which is characterized by square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and produces small, tubular flowers in shades of pink or purple. Its leaves are fragrant and often used in traditional herbal medicine for their antiseptic properties. Satureja forbesii thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to dry, rocky environments.
